fog_machine_problem.goal: Realistic fog/smoke machine effect in Unity particle system

desired_behavior.at_emitter: Thick, dense smoke - particles tightly clustered
desired_behavior.mid_range: Mass of smoke moves together with momentum, begins slowing
desired_behavior.far_range: Particles slow down, spread out, and dissipate

recurring_failure.symptom: Particles are evenly spaced near the base, looks like a bead string not smoke
recurring_failure.root_cause: Setting high startSpeed causes each particle to immediately rocket away from origin on spawn, creating even spacing regardless of emission rate

correct_approach.emission_rate: Massive (500-1000+/sec) so particles stack at the nozzle
correct_approach.velocity_over_lifetime: Curve that starts moderate and drops to near-zero
correct_approach.external_force: Use a force zone or wind to push the whole MASS forward
correct_approach.key_insight: Density comes from particles born on top of each other and staying close. Cloud movement comes from external forces pushing the group, NOT individual particle startSpeed.

working_relationship_notes.claude_code_vs_regular_claude: User has experienced significantly better results with Claude Code (can read actual project files, see errors, iterate tightly) vs regular Claude (trial-and-error, often fails or produces barely-acceptable results)
working_relationship_notes.user_preferences: Straight talk, no overselling capabilities, practical results over theory
working_relationship_notes.strength_areas: Shader work, script extraction/refactoring, Unity C# scripting, Blender Python for non-organic geometry
working_relationship_notes.known_weakness: Procedural organic modeling (e.g. human heads from photos) - not realistic to attempt
